subject: Creativity
title: The Eureka Myth: Breakthroughs Don't Happen in Bathtubs
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Eureka Myth: Breakthroughs Don't Happen in Bathtubs.

hook.text: Archimedes jumped from his bath screaming 'Eureka!' Newton watched an apple fall.

buildup.text: The Archimedes bath story first appeared 200 years after his death. The Newton apple story has no contemporary evidence.

discovery.text: Real breakthroughs are messy, gradual, and collaborative. Darwin's evolution idea developed over 20+ years, not in a flash.

twist.text: The eureka myth hurts creativity because it implies breakthroughs are random events.

climax.text: Even the best 'sudden insight' stories (like KekulÃ©'s snake dream about benzene) happened after years of intense work.

punchline.text: Eureka moments don't fall from the sky. They're earned through years of.

quiz.question: What's wrong with the 'eureka myth' about creativity?
options: It implies breakthroughs are random rather than the result of sustained work
